intro: Nasa ranunculifolia subsp. guzmangoensis, commonly known as the Guzmangoensis Nasa, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, humid habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
